subject: Re: Junit's Importance

messageBody:
We've been using JUnit with Ant for a few months now. The main
advantages for us are the support base for JUnit -- if we run into a
problem, we can turn to discussion groups for help -- and that the
open source community is continuously improving JUnit. So we don't
have to worry about developing and maintaining our own testing tool.

JUnit can also work with other tools, such as Ant and HTTPUnit. The
combination of these tools give us a framework from which we can
quickly put together automated test suites.

JUnit does have some limitations. We use it for functional testing
rather than strictly unit testing, and we've had to tweak it here and
there (nice to have the source code available, in those cases). I
introduced JUnit to my manager in the context of a pilot project, and
it helped my team to understand its capabilities and limitations
before implementing it. As a result, we typically mix some of JUnit's
features with some of our own techniques when we write our black-box
tests.

-- Todd
